title: Jairo Zulbarán
text:
Jairo Luís Zulbarán, known as Calanche (7 January 1970 – 15 March 2002), was a <a href="Colombian%20people">Colombian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Santa%20Marta">Santa Marta</a>, Zulbarán began his professional football career with <a href="Uni%C3%B3n%20Magdalena">Unión Magdalena</a> and would play for Sporting de Barranquilla, <a href="Independiente%20Medell%C3%ADn">Independiente Medellín</a>, <a href="Millonarios%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Club">Millonarios</a> and Unicosta. He is one of Unicosta's all-time leading goal-scorers. He ended his career early after having problems with his knee ligaments.
International career.
Zulbarán competed for Colombia at the <a href="1989%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">1989 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> in <a href="Saudi%20Arabia">Saudi Arabia</a> and the <a href="1992%20Summer%20Olympics">1992 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>.
Personal life and death.
In March 2002, Zulbarán was shot dead in a public market in downtown <a href="Santa%20Marta">Santa Marta</a>.
